Tell state lawmakers to secure safe and legal abortion for all in our Commonwealth.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Abortion rights will soon face their first serious test since Justice Kavanaugh's appointment to the Supreme Court. On March 4, the justices will hear oral arguments in a case that could force abortion care out of reach.

June Medical Services v. Gee concerns so-called TRAP laws, which impose medically unnecessary restrictions on abortion clinics. It's nearly identical to a case the Supreme Court already dismissed, but a new anti-abortion majority could reverse that precedent and force clinics to close.

While we continue to see states trying to push abortion out of reach, our leaders here in Massachusetts have an opportunity to do something different. Tell them to pass the ROE Act and make safe, legal abortion accessible for all.

With so much on the line, Massachusetts needs to reaffirm its commitment to our basic reproductive freedoms. Our leaders cannot afford to be complacent and ignore the urgency of the threats we face.

Tell lawmakers to pass the ROE Act now.

In solidarity,

ACLU of Massachusetts
